# Static Pod Container Check

- [Static Pod Container Check](#static-pod-container-check)
  - [Overview](#overview)
  - [Installation](#installation)
    - [Ignition Config](#ignition-config)
    - [Site Config ignitionConfigOverride](#site-config-ignitionconfigoverride)

## Overview

The `static-pod-check-workaround.sh` utility monitors the state of static pod containers, triggering a restart of
`kubelet.service` if any given pod is deemed unhealthy for too long.

```console
Usage: static-pod-check-workaround.sh
Options:
    --dryrun | -n                 Dry run (don't restart kubelet, log only)
    --verbose | -v                Turn on debug logs
    --log-to-stdout               Log to stdout instead of journald
    --manifests-dir | -m          Location of static pod manifests (default: /etc/kubernetes/manifests)
    --kubelet-up-min <secs>       Minimum time, in seconds, kubelet must be active
                                  before allowing health checks to run (default: 1200)
    --healthy-interval <secs>     Interval between checks, in seconds, when static
                                  pods are healthy (default: 300)
    --unhealthy-interval <secs>   Interval between checks, in seconds, when static
                                  pods are unhealthy (default: 30)
    --max-failures <int>          Maximum consecutive health check failures for any given pod
                                  before restarting kubelet (default: 20)
```

Before running any checks on the static pods, the script first verifies that `kubelet.service` has been active for a
minimum period. This period can be configured using the `--kubelet-up-min` option, with a default of 1200 seconds
(20 minutes).

Once `kubelet.service` is active for the minimum period, the following checks are performed:

- Query the status of running containers, caching `crictl ps -o json` output for the container checks.
- Parse the static pod manifests for `system-node-critical` pods to get a list of containers and verify that each
  container is running.
- If any given static pod does not have all its containers in a running state, that pod is considered to be unhealthy
  and a per-pod failure counter is incremented.
- If any given static pod reaches the maximum number of consecutive health check failures allowed, `kubelet.service`
  will be restarted. This maximum is configurable with the `--max-failures` option, defaulted to 20 consecutive
  failures.

If all static pods are healthy, the checks are performed every 300 seconds (configurable with the `--healthy-interval`
option). If there are unhealthy pods, rechecks are performed every 30 seconds (configurable with the
`--unhealthy-interval` option).

By default, logs are written to journald with a tag of `static-pod-check-workaround`.

## Installation

The utility can be installed onto a node with an ignition config, writing the script along with a corresponding
service-unit file to run as a service. Configuration options can be passed to the script from the service-unit
`ExecStart` command-line.

For example, to install the script with a service-unit passing `-v --max-failures 30` as configuration options, you
would have the following ignition config:

### Ignition Config

```json
{
  "ignition": {
    "version": "3.2.0"
  },
  "systemd": {
    "units": [
      {
        "name": "static-pod-check-workaround.service",
        "enabled": true,
        "contents": "[Unit]\nDescription=Check for stuck static pod revisions\nAfter=kubelet.service\n\n[Service]\nType=simple\nUser=root\n\nExecStart=/usr/local/bin/static-pod-check-workaround.sh -v --max-failures 30\n\n[Install]\nWantedBy=multi-user.target\n"
      }
    ]
  },
  "storage": {
    "files": [
      {
        "overwrite": true,
        "path": "/usr/local/bin/static-pod-check-workaround.sh",
        "mode": 744,
        "user": {
          "name": "root"
        },
        "contents": {
          "source": "data:text/plain;charset=utf-8;base64,"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

### Site Config ignitionConfigOverride

As an ignitionConfigOverride in a site-config file, add the following to each node configuration:

```yaml
ignitionConfigOverride: '{ "ignition": { "version": "3.2.0" }, "systemd": { "units": [ { "name": "static-pod-check-workaround.service", "enabled": true, "contents": "[Unit]\nDescription=Check for stuck static pod revisions\nAfter=kubelet.service\n\n[Service]\nType=simple\nUser=root\n\nExecStart=/usr/local/bin/static-pod-check-workaround.sh -v --max-failures 30\n\n[Install]\nWantedBy=multi-user.target\n" } ] }, "storage": { "files": [ { "overwrite": true, "path": "/usr/local/bin/static-pod-check-workaround.sh", "mode": 744, "user": { "name": "root" }, "contents": { "source": "data:text/plain;charset=utf-8;base64," } } ] } } '
```
